実践Apache Iceberg | 技術評論社
https://gihyo.jp/book/2025/978-4-297-15074-7

external.description: Apache Icebergは、ストレージ上のファイル群を抽象化し分散クエリエンジンで扱うためのオープンな「テーブルフォーマット」です。本書では、データレイク構築に関する基本的な考え方やIcebergを使うことのメリットといった基本から、Sparkなどの各種分散クエリエンジンにおける実践的な活用方法、そして実運用のためのノウハウまで、豊富なハンズオンとともに解説。次世代のデータ基盤の構築・運用に関わるエンジニア必携の一冊です。
external.title: 実践Apache Iceberg | 技術評論社

📌 Dropzone AI raises $37M in Series B led by Theory Ventures to enhance AI SOC solution. #CyberSecurity #AI https://tinyurl.com/2c49al4b

external.description:
Dropzone AI has announced a significant Series B funding round of $37 million, led by Theory Ventures, aimed at enhancing its autonomous SOC analyst solution. This development underscores the growing trend of leveraging artificial intelligence to automate and improve security operations. An autonomous SOC analyst solution typically involves machine learning models trained to identify and respond to threats, potentially reducing the workload on human analysts and improving response times.

The technical implications of this funding are substantial. The investment will likely be used to enhance AI models, possibly through advanced techniques like deep learning or reinforcement learning. This could involve integrating more data sources or improving the solution's ability to handle false positives and negatives. The impact on the cybersecurity landscape is profound, as automation in SOCs can lead to more efficient and effective threat detection and response.

However, the adoption of autonomous SOC solutions also presents challenges. Ensuring the accuracy and reliability of AI models is paramount, as is the ability of these systems to adapt to new and evolving threats. Cybersecurity professionals must approach such technologies with a strategy for thorough validation and testing before full deployment.

From an expert perspective, the integration of AI into SOCs is a significant step forward, but it requires careful consideration. Transparency and explainability of AI-driven decisions are crucial for building trust among human analysts. Organizations should monitor developments in autonomous SOC solutions and consider how these technologies could be integrated into their own operations, while being mindful of potential risks and challenges.

In conclusion, Dropzone AI's funding round highlights the increasing role of AI in cybersecurity operations. While the potential benefits are substantial, it is essential to approach such advancements with a balanced view, ensuring robust validation and testing to maintain security and reliability.
external.title: Dropzone AI Secures $37M Series B Funding to Advance Autonomous SOC Analyst Solution

external.description: The ransomware group GLOBAL GROUP has targeted Albavisión, a major media corporation, claiming to have stolen 400 GB of data. This attack is part of a broader campaign employing advanced extortion tactics against various sectors globally. While the specific types of data stolen and the immediate impacts on Albavisión are not detailed, the scale of the breach underscores the severity of the incident. The attack highlights the evolving tactics of ransomware groups, which now often involve data exfiltration and threats of public leaks in addition to encryption. For cybersecurity professionals, this incident serves as a reminder of the importance of robust defense mechanisms, including regular backups, advanced threat detection, and comprehensive incident response plans. The use of advanced extortion tactics by GLOBAL GROUP indicates a trend towards more sophisticated and damaging attacks, necessitating a proactive and layered approach to cybersecurity. Organizations should prioritize network segmentation, employee training, and regular testing of incident response plans to mitigate the risk of such attacks. This incident also underscores the need for continuous monitoring and threat intelligence sharing to stay ahead of emerging threats.

record.text: 📌 Navigating Cybersecurity Careers: Insights from a Seasoned CISO https://www.cyberhub.blog/article/10649-navigating-cybersecurity-careers-insights-from-a-seasoned-ciso

external.description:
The cybersecurity landscape is complex and ever-evolving, requiring professionals to continuously adapt and learn. A seasoned Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) with 15 years of experience across five industries shares valuable insights on career development in cybersecurity. The author highlights the challenges of providing career advice to newcomers and emphasizes the importance of attitude and aptitude when hiring beginners. This perspective underscores the significance of soft skills such as curiosity and passion for the field, which are crucial for continuous learning and adaptation in cybersecurity.

For mid-career professionals aspiring to become CISOs, the author's willingness to offer advice is particularly valuable. Transitioning to a CISO role involves not just deep technical knowledge but also strategic thinking, risk management, and leadership skills. The author's diverse industry experience provides a well-rounded perspective on the multifaceted responsibilities of a CISO.

The emphasis on attitude and aptitude in hiring beginners suggests a shift in the cybersecurity landscape towards valuing soft skills alongside technical competencies. This could influence educational programs and training initiatives to focus more on developing these soft skills. For mid-career professionals, understanding the broader responsibilities of a CISO, including strategic planning and stakeholder communication, is essential for effective preparation.

In conclusion, the insights from a seasoned CISO highlight the importance of soft skills and continuous learning in cybersecurity careers. For newcomers, focusing on attitude and aptitude is crucial, while mid-career professionals should seek guidance to understand the broader responsibilities of a CISO role. These insights provide actionable intelligence for professionals at different stages of their cybersecurity careers.
external.title: Navigating Cybersecurity Careers: Insights from a Seasoned CISO

The political perspective dominates this conversation but it would be very valuable for serious economists to look closely at why Biden’s policies worked while Trump’s are failing.

Enormously valuable and important insights abound but nobody seems to be seizing that professional opportunity.

As a retired exec I’ve got a lot of experience in the “war for talent.” 

Can’t say I ever stumbled across the “pedophile pimp talent wars” but I can recognize the patterns and reactions.

Btw - it’s probably global on both the talent and pimping side so keep your eyes open.

This only works economically if you have access to a large population of forced labor at pennies on the dollar which…. I guess is coming? 

Trump’s economic strategy has many twists and turns. Making “full autonomy” work through immigrant and POC slavery is… interesting? 

I guess. For someone?

I'm slowly losing it... In the end I wrote NOTHING 😭

record.text: So feel free to argue what you like, when you like, but until you do the thinking nec. to come up with a coherent position, I won't be taking your thoughts on this issue any more seriously than I take the idea that you're arguing to moderate left wingers at the same time you're moving the OW left.

What I do know is that the argument you're making is bullshit because it requires BOTH Dems dumping left votes to effectively win elections AND left voters staying home to be responsible for Dems losing elections.

Do I think that you think you believe these things? 

I am not sure, but I lean yes. 

Is it possible for you to believe these things at the same time? No it is not. 

If I had to guess, I think you experience cognitive dissonance and avoid thinking about one while talking about the other.

After ingesting all of it, AI companies used what amounts to the collective history of our species to create software that obscures its very richness and complexity. Becoming overly dependent on it may rob people of the opportunity to draw conclusions from looking at the evidence for themselves.

The chatgpt study mode is here. It will not solve the problems of the education of education

The school year It begins soon for many students, and Chatgpt has announced a new "study mode" that aims to prevent, or at least, encourage students to take task shortcuts. The mode is designed around the…

external.description: The school year It begins soon for many students, and Chatgpt has announced a new "study mode" that aims to prevent, or at least, encourage students to take task shortcuts. The mode is designed around the Socratic Method, so when activated, the OpenAi generative chat rejects direct requests for answers, instead of guiding the user with open questions. The new study mode is available for most chatgpt users, including those of the free version.
external.title: The chatgpt study mode is here. It will not solve the problems of the education of education

external.description: O Concello de Lugo anunciou melloras na plataforma municipal de xestión de Servizos Sociais para, nas súas palabras, “reforzar a atención á cidadanía e a coordinación entre departamentos”. A aplicación, que permite a tramitación integral dos expedientes asistenciais e a coordinación entre departamentos, foi impulsada no seu día co apoio da estratexia europea DUSI – Muramiñae para avanzar na modernización da administración local e mellorar a calidade dos servizos públicos.

record.text:
Are you listening, DART?

People want carefree access to storefronts, homes, and workplaces without needing to walk across a half mile of blazing asphalt.

Is it so much to ask to air condition Plano’s parking lots and provide AI-powered rickshaws to ferry people to the front door from their cars?

value.text: I won't be happy until they put more parking spaces near the entrance. It's 2025! Why am I still walking more than 30 feet to get inside.

record.text:
We couldn’t agree more.

Unfortunately, the money that Plano could spend on researching practical transportation solutions like parking spaces that store cars in temporary wormholes is being squandered on public transit.

Plano is a world class place to park, but its full potential is unrealized.

The City of Plano accepted the coveted City of Excellence award from Pave the Earth, an industry group that represents parking lot paving and striping companies around the world.

“Plano isn’t fighting a war on walking. The war is over, and Plano has won. The City of Excellence inspires us all.”
